result.execSummary:
The defendant Matheau T Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 10 days were
granted if imposed.
Probation may be transferred to Racine County

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign medical releases for agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
2nd amended information

Defendant Matheau T Shaw in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files 2nd amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #1-3 on 2nd amended information filed today.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1-3 on 2nd amended information.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:     
     
6 MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - 10 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR       **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO RACINE COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:   45 DAYS, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED- to be used at agent's discretion

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:     **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #1**
     
6 MONTHS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR       **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO RACINE COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

COUNT #3:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:    

30 DAYS HUBER       **CONCURRENT WITH COUNTS #1 & 2**  

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR       **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO RACINE COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

NOTE:  CASH BAIL POSTED TO BE RETURNED TO PERSON WHO POSTED IT
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Matheau T Shaw in court with Attorney Nick Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez requests a plea and sentence date.  Court grants request.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on July 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Matheau T Shaw in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez requests a 30 day adjournment to review discovery.  State does not object.  Court adjourns.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Case not called on the record.   Defendant Matheau T Shaw not in court.  Timothy F Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez contacted the court clerk early this morning stating he could not appear today as he is ill.  Court adjourns.      Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Hearing on June 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.
